com.TeamJava.PaddleWars
Class bonusManager

java.lang.Object
  com.TeamJava.PaddleWars.bonusManager
public class bonusManager
extends java.lang.Object

Handles all of the bonuses availible. The Intercept class acesses it if a bonus ball intercects a paddle. This class then places limits on paddle and ball properties, and modifies them according to the bonus generated originally in the paddleWars class.

Since:
1/9/03
See Also:
intercept, PaddleWars

Method Detail

giveBonus

public void giveBonus(int paddle,
                      int ball)
This Method is used by the intercept class to acess this class. This method gets which paddle recieved the ball, and which ball that was, passed into it. It then gets the balls bonus type, and determines which method to run.

Parameters:
paddle - Which paddle the ball intercepted
ball - Which ball in the Ball array, which is a bonus, intercepted the paddle

increasePaddleY

private void increasePaddleY(int paddle)
Test what the paddle's current y size is, and increases it or does nothing. Depending on the starting size.

Parameters:
paddle - which paddle to act upon.

decreasePaddleY

private void decreasePaddleY(int paddle)
Test what the paddle's current y size is, and decreases it or does nothing. Depending on the starting size.

Parameters:
paddle - which paddle to act upon.

increaseScore

private void increaseScore(int paddle1,
                           int paddle2)
Add the paramaters passed in to paddle 1 & 2's score, respectivley.

Parameters:
paddle1 - How much to increase paddle 1's score
paddle2 - How much to increase paddle 2's score

enableSpecialKey

private void enableSpecialKey(int paddle)
This method will test to see if the Paddle's Hyper key is enabled. If it isnt, it will enable their Hyper movement key. This is actually done by increasing the paddle's Hyper movement rate, as the Hyper movement key is always availible, but defaultly set to normal movement.

Parameters:
paddle - which paddle to enable.
